meanings.definition: The act of pouring a liquid from one container to another, typically to separate sediment or impurities.
meanings.sent1: During the decantations, the chef carefully poured the wine into a new glass pitcher.
meanings.sent2: My mom used decantations to remove the settled particles from the homemade juice.
meanings.sent3: The decantations at the science fair looked like a magic show with all the colorful liquids being poured.
meanings.sent4: The decantations in the laboratory seemed like a dance of liquids moving gracefully from one flask to another.
meanings.sent5: The decantations of the muddy water made the separation of dirt and clean water crystal clear.

meanings.definition: A series of rituals or ceremonies involving the pouring of liquids, often associated with magic or alchemy.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe performed mystical decantations to summon rain during the dry season.
meanings.sent2: The wizard's decantations were said to have the power to transform ordinary water into gold.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended to do secret decantations with their toy tea set.
meanings.sent4: The magician's decantations were so mesmerizing that the audience believed in real magic.
meanings.sent5: The decantations of the potion created a magical aura in the dimly lit room.
